question.title: Extracting common prefix in WebFlux @RouterOperations
question.body:
If multiple controller methods share the same prefix (e.g. an API version), I could extract it into a class-level @RequestMapping annotation, like so:

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api") // shared prefix
public class UserController {
    // controller methods
}

But how do I do it in WebFlux?

@Configuration
public class RouterConfig {

    private final TokenHandler tokenHandler;

    public RouterConfig(TokenHandler tokenHandler) {
        this.tokenHandler = tokenHandler;
    }

    @Bean
    @RouterOperation(beanClass = TokenHandler.class, beanMethod = "signUp")
    public RouterFunction<ServerResponse> signUp() {
        return RouterFunctions.route()
                .POST("/api/signup", tokenHandler::signUp)
                .build();
    }

    @Bean
    @RouterOperation(beanClass = TokenHandler.class, beanMethod = "logIn")
    public RouterFunction<ServerResponse> logIn() {
        return RouterFunctions.route()
                .POST("/api/login", tokenHandler::logIn) // prefix gets duplicated
                .build();
    }
}

RouterFunctions.nest(..) looks promising. However, if possible, I'd like to have those RouterFunctions declared independently, similarly to controller methods.
